meanings.definition: extorters: people who obtain something by force or threats
meanings.sent1: The extorters demanded money from the shop owner using threats.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the extorters who were intimidating the local businesses.
meanings.sent3: The extorters tried to scare the children into giving them their toys.
meanings.sent4: The extorters loomed over the small town, causing fear and chaos.
meanings.sent5: The image of the extorters with their menacing looks stayed in the villagers' minds.

meanings.definition: extorters: those who coerce others into giving up money or valuables
meanings.sent1: The extorters threatened to harm the family if they didn't pay up.
meanings.sent2: The gang of extorters targeted wealthy individuals for their schemes.
meanings.sent3: The extorters tried to trick the old man into handing over his savings.
meanings.sent4: The extorters' greed knew no bounds as they extorted from the vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The town lived in fear of the extorters lurking in the shadows.
